lexUnit.name: smoke.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: inhale and exhale the smoke of tobacco or a drug.

sentence.text: They were smoking cigars , hawking and spitting and shaking hands with friends or associates .
His voice was muffled by something --could it be that he was smoking a cigar even whilst disembodied ?
She smoked cheap cigars , and the ash lay on her cardigans like catkins .
He was thin and softly spoken and smoked an expensive cigar .
I smoked one of daddy 's cigars .
Someone once told me that even breathing the air was the equivalent of smoking twenty cigarettes a day .
She had smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for six years and was taking no medication .
I sat on it and smoked a cigarette before falling asleep in the long grass .
We found that 65% of the patients smoked at least one cigarette a day , a proportion nearly twice as high as that in the general population .
He was smoking a lethal smelling cigarette .
We smoked dope and people who wanted to would take sillacybin , mescalin or LSD , and that was literally it .
During the sixties and seventies there were a good many ` hip " stars smoking dope and dropping acid , emulating their counterparts in rock music .
We smoked some dope with the girls and went to have an omelette .
Sitting on the large stone that marked this spot was a thin , white-haired man in a cloth cap , smoking his pipe .
We could n't have guessed it was a tramp smoking a pipe . "
Smoke your pipe and enjoy it .
To this end , he often smoked his pipe during the game and always insisted on playing in his slippers .
He had a high-domed bald head and smoked a curved pipe .
I heard him pumping up the pressure and singing a folk song which began , ` We do n't smoke pot in Norwich City " .
Smoking crack during pregnancy can cause low birth-weight , respiratory problems and premature labour .
We smoke a joint in my car .
He smoked it deliberately in slow puffs , giving Peter time to consider their situation .
Men smoke more marijuana in the South and eat more fast food in the North .
An investigation at Dean Close School in Cheltenham revealed that seven A level pupils had smoked cannabis in woodland near the school in the last week of term .
A pub landlord in Oxford has been charged with allowing his customers to smoke cannabis on his premises .
She was smoking her joint with quick snatches of breath , like a swimmer doing the crawl .
Inside the ramshackle buildings , people huddled in alcoves under dangling AV screens , smoking waterpipes , drinking beer and arguing .
We use razors to cut blunts [ cigars ] open and smoke some weed .
Freebase is a compound that can be inhaled or smoked .
Most users smoke it only occasionally .
Wycliffe smoked quietly .
Smoking habits of boys and girls are roughly the same up to the age of 12 , but as adolescence approaches , more girls than boys smoke regularly .
In 1982 , the government 's first national survey of children 's smoking found that 11% of both boys and girls aged 11-16 smoked regularly .
They stood smoking at the end of the passage and watched Auriega .
Looking around for a possible light , we noticed an elderly couple smoking at a nearby tables .
Smoking at work is only permitted in accordance with the Council 's policy .
The tyrant Primo de Rivera loved circuses , and loved big cigars , which he smoked during the performance , though it was forbidden .
Jasper smoked for show .
I do n't want to smoke in the office .
Bella lit a cigarette , which she smoked now with a holder .
I do n't smoke .
He smoked incessantly until dawn lit the sky and then he cautiously looked around .
